alert.note: Alert for Elk; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Elk, Wilson, Neosho and southeastern Greenwood Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 813 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fredonia, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rain will create ponding water on roadways increasing the risk of hydroplaning. Localized flooding is Also likely. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Chanute, Neodesha, Fredonia, Erie, St. Paul, Thayer, Altoona, Buffalo, Fall River, Galesburg, Benedict, Stark, New Albany, Earlton, Coyville, Lake Parsons, Buxton, Fall River State Park and Chanute Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
